unittitle.value: Godzilla Asian American Arts Network Archive

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: The Godzilla Asian American Arts Network Archive houses the materials of the Godzilla Asian American Arts Network. The collection includes correspondence, exhibition dossiers, administrative materials, publications, and related materials.

p.value: Open to researchers without access restrictions. Appointments are necessary to consult archive and manuscript material.

Published citations should take the following form:
                <lb/>
                <lb/> Identification of item, date (if known); The Godzilla Asian American Arts Network Archive; MSS 166; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

Godzilla was an Asian American arts collective and support network founded in 1990. Godzilla's founding members believed that Asian American artists did not have a suitable organization to support, promote, and encourage their visual arts, and Godzilla sought to fill this need. Godzilla disbanded in 2001.

The Godzilla Asian American Arts Network Archive contains documents relating to the activities and goals of the Godzilla Asian American Arts Network. Included are documents detailing the administrative and artistic aspects of Godzilla and related arts organizations.

dsc.value:
Series I: Correspondence Scope and Contents note

This series contains Godzilla's correspondence from 1991-2001, as well as letters to send to artists and files kept by Lynne Yamamoto and Godzilla founder Ken Chu. Ken Chu's folders contain notices of upcoming art exhibitions sent to him by artitsts, two slides of his own work, and a newspaper clipping. Lynne Yamamoto's folder, separated into two parts, holds correspondence and administrative documents she collected.

 Correspondence 1991-1993 1 1 1991-1993 Correspondence 1994 1 2 1994 Correspondence 1995 1 3 1996 Correspondence 1996-2001 1 4 1996-2001 Undated Correspondence 1 5 undated Correspondence to Godzilla artists regarding From Basement to Godzilla 1 6 undated Correspondence sent to Ken Chu 1 7 1994-1995 Correspondence from Dan Gilbert to Ken Chu, enclosing two slides of Chu's artwork 1 8 1994 Clipping of Off-Campus newspaper collected by Chu 1 9 1994 Correspondence collected by Lynne Yamamoto 1 10 A 1991-1993 Godzilla administrative documents collected by Lynne Yamamoto 1 10 B 1991 Series II: Exhibitions Scope and Contents note

This series contains dossiers from Godzilla's various exhibitions, including photographs, brochures, and logistical documents. Nine exhibitions are included, as well as miscellaneous photographs.

 New World Order III: The Curio Shop Exhibition Dossier 1 11 1993 Word Gets Around Project Materials 1 12 1994-1997 Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles...Not! and Reed Arts Weekend Documents 1 13 1994-1995 Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles...Not! Exibition Dossier 1 14 1995-1997 And We Speak Exhibition Dossier 1 15 1996 Travel-Sized Exhibition Dossier 1 16 1997 The Bank/Why Are You Here? Exhibition Documents 1 17 1997 Fermented Exhibition Documents 1 18 1997 Art in General:Why Asia? Exhibition Documents 1 19 2001 Miscellaneous Photos 1 20 undated Gallery Submission Guidelines 1 21 various Series III: Newsletters and Publicity Scope and Contents note

Series III comprises the Godzilla newsletter and publishing information as well as the "Godzillette" bulletin, an issue of New Observations magazine edited by Godzilla, and Godzilla events fliers.

 Godzilla Newsletters and Publication Information 1 22 1991-1995 "Godzillettes" 1 23 1991-1996 New Observations Magazine #107 (Guest Editor: Godzilla) 1 24 1995 Godzilla Events Fliers 1 25 1992-2001 Series IV: Administrative Materials Scope and Contents note

Series IV contains administrative materials broken down into two subseries: organizational documents and financial documents. Subseries A: Organizational Documents has introductory and operations information, contact sheets, steering committee minutes and other administrative documents such as a questionnaire and Godzilla stationary. Suberies B: Financial Documents holds Godzilla's financial records from 1991-2003, along with grant applications and miscellaneous/undated financial records and other document fragments.

 Subseries A: Organizational Documents Godzilla Introduction and Operations Information 1 26 1994-1998 Godzilla Contact Sheets 1 27 various Steering Committee Minutes 1 28 1993-1995 Godzilla Spring 1994 Questionnaire 1 29 1994 Godzilla Stationary 1 30 undated Subseries B: Financial Documents Godzilla Financial Records 1991 1 31 1991 Godzilla Financial Records 1992 1 32 1992 Godzilla Financial Records 1993 1 33 1993 Godzilla Financial Records 1994 1 34 1994 Godzilla Financial Records 1995 1 35 1995 Godzilla Financial Records 1996 1 36 1996 Godzilla Financial Records 1997 1 37 1997 Godzilla Financial Records 1998 1 38 1998 Godzilla Financial Records 1999 1 39 1999 Godzilla Financial Records 2000 1 40 2000 Godzilla Financial Records 2001 1 41 2001 Godzilla Financial Records 2002 1 42 2002 Godzilla Financial Records 2003 1 43 2003 Miscellaneous Godzilla Financial Records 1 44 various Godzilla Grant Materials 1 45 1991-1995 North Star Fund Materials 1 46 1994 Miscellaneous Fragments 1 47 undated Series V: Related Organizations Scope and Contents note

Series V comprises various documents, articles, and publications either published by or related to organizations related to Godzilla. Some organizations, such as the Asian American Arts Alliance, collaborated with Godzilla; others simply had a similar purpose. Series V contains three subseries: Documents, Publications, and Items of Interest to Godzilla. Series A: Documents houses ideas for collaboratory projects, financial information, and operating information about related organizations. Subseries B: Publications contains journals, newsletters, and exhibition brochures from similar arts organizations. Subseries C: Items of Interest to Godzilla holds newspaper clippings and articles collected by Godzilla that either feature Godzilla and/or a related organization, or address a cause related to Godzilla's purpose.

 Subseries A: Documents from Related Organizations Collaboratory Proposals 1 48 various Documents from Related Organizations 1 49 1993-1994 Asian American Arts Alliance Financial Documents 1 50 1993, 1995 Subseries B: Publications Asian American Arts Alliance Publications 1 51 1990-1995 Publications of Related Organizations 1 52 1986-1998 Exhibit Brochures 1 53 1991-2001 Subseries C: Items of Interest to Godzilla Newspaper Clippings 1 54 1991-1996 Articles of Interest Collected by Godzilla 1 55 various OVERSIZE Series II: Exhibitions Scope and Contents note

Series II OVERSIZE houses a collector's set of prints from the From Basement to Godzilla exhibition.
